intro: Ixalum inerme, commonly known as the common ixalum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Ixalum inerme is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest flowering display.
